result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: See terms of Deferred Judgment Agreement
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $620.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI without a valid prescription. 
No entry into any bars, taverns or other places that serve alcohol as a principal business. 
No contact with S.C..
No contact with M.H. without prior agent approval.

Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1 of 22CF19.
Any medications, including those prescribed, must have prior agent approval.
May take any medications necessary during labor of child.
Substance Abuse evaluation and follow through.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must fully cooperate with the Child Support Agency.
DNA sample due 10-12-2022.

2:05 PM Defendant Allie A. Kropp in court.  Attorney Travis A. Crowell in court for Allie A. Kropp.  Attorney Mitchell Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF19 and 22CF131.
Atty Crowell provides plea form.
ADA provides copy of DJA.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Crowell agrees.
Victim rights compliance.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CF19.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2 of 22CF19.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2 of 22CF131.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court informs of possible firearm and voting restrictions, if found guilty to Count 1 of 22CF19.
Deft understands.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Crowell satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea but withholds the finding of guilt on Count 1 of 22CF19, subject to the terms of the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters pleas freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts the pleas and finds Deft guilty to Count 2 of 22CF19 and Count 2 of 22CF131.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1 and 3 of 22CF131.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Crowell heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court accepts the terms of the DJA.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 2 of 22CF19: 
6 months jail, and places Deft on probation for 2 years.
Conditions of probation:
Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1 of 22CF19.
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $620.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No contact with M.H. without prior agent approval.
Substance Abuse evaluation and follow through.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must obtain a GED.
Must fully cooperate with the Child Support Agency.
DNA sample due 10-12-2022.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 2 of 22CF131:
90 days jail, consecutive to the jail sentence on Count 2 of 22CF19, and places Deft on probation for 2 years.
Full compliance with the DJA on Count 1 of 22CF19.
